modelSwitchDisabled: Claude Code uses its own tools and can't share chat history with other models
deleteChatHistoryDescription: This will permanently delete the chat history and remove all context from this session.
emptyState: Start a conversation with the AI agent.
inputPlaceholder: Ask the agent to do something...
undoConfirmDescription_one: This will revert {{count}} file to its previous state.
undoConfirmDescription_other: This will revert {{count}} files to their previous state.
proceedApproveAllHint: File writes will be auto-approved for this session until chat history is cleared.
creationHeading: What would you like to build?
creationSubheading: Describe your app and Awel will create it for you.
creationPlaceholder: Describe what you want to build...
creationError: Something went wrong. Please try again.
creationSaasPlaceholder: e.g. Project management for remote teams, AI writing assistant...
creationAgencyPlaceholder: e.g. Brand identity design, Product photography, Motion graphics...
creationProductPlaceholder: e.g. Wireless earbuds, Artisan candles, Fitness app...
creationLocalPlaceholder: e.g. Italian trattoria, Craft coffee roaster, Ramen bar...
creationReviewSubheading: Edit the prompt if needed, then start building.
creationTemplateSubheading: Choose a category to generate a detailed design prompt.
creationCustomSubheading: Describe what you want to build in your own words.
chooseModelFirst: Choose a model to get started.
noModelsAvailable: No models available. Configure a provider to continue.
confirmAllowAllHint: Applies for the entire session until chat history is cleared.
confirmAllowAllHintPending: Approves all {{count}} pending and future requests for this session.
claudeCodeWarningDescription: Claude Code will automatically approve all file edits and shell commands without asking for your confirmation.
claudeCodeWarningWithClearDescription: Claude Code will automatically approve all file edits and shell commands without asking for your confirmation. Your current chat history will also be deleted.
claudeCodeSwitchDescription: Switching between Claude Code and other models requires clearing chat history. Your current conversation will be deleted.
styleSaasGradientDesc: Cutting-edge design with fluid gradients, purples and blues
styleSaasDarkDesc: Powerful night aesthetic with glowing accents
styleProductLuxuryDesc: Premium boutique experience with refined restraint
styleProductGlassDesc: Layered depth with frosted glass effects
styleProductBoldDesc: Energetic pop with saturated colors and dynamic shapes
styleLocalWarmDesc: Inviting warmth with natural, earthy tones
promptSaasGradient:
Create a ONE-PAGE LANDING PAGE for a SaaS product: {{context}}. Use a GRADIENT MODERN design style.

The design should feel cutting-edge yet trustworthy—like stepping into a sleek command center where complex technology becomes effortlessly accessible. Typography should feel confident and forward-thinking. Use smooth, fluid animations that feel like liquid transitions between states. The color palette should feature sophisticated gradient transitions (purples, blues, teals) that create depth and dimension.

Draw inspiration from premium technology experiences—the satisfying precision of well-crafted interfaces, the clarity of world-class products. The page should feel like a glimpse into the future of how work gets done.
promptSaasDark:
Create a ONE-PAGE LANDING PAGE for a SaaS product: {{context}}. Use a DARK MODE ELEGANT design style.

The design should feel powerful and sophisticated—like a mission control center at night. Rich, deep backgrounds (near-black with subtle blue or purple undertones) with high-contrast text and glowing accent colors. Typography should feel sharp and precise. Subtle light effects—glows, subtle gradients—should make key elements feel luminous. Animations should feel smooth and purposeful.

Draw inspiration from the drama of nighttime cityscapes, the focused intensity of professional creative tools, the premium feel of high-end audio equipment interfaces.
promptSaasMinimal:
Create a ONE-PAGE LANDING PAGE for a SaaS product: {{context}}. Use a CLEAN MINIMAL / SWISS design style.

The design should feel crisp, confident, and systematically organized—every element placed with mathematical intention. Generous whitespace signals clarity of thought. Typography should be clean and highly legible, perhaps a refined sans-serif. A strict grid brings order. Colors should be restrained: perhaps just black, white, and one carefully chosen accent color.

Draw inspiration from Swiss design principles, the clarity of well-organized information, the confidence that comes from knowing exactly what matters.
promptAgencyEditorial:
Create a ONE-PAGE PORTFOLIO LANDING PAGE for: {{context}}. Use an EDITORIAL design style.

The design should feel like opening a beautifully curated magazine spread—sophisticated, intentional, with every element earning its place. Typography is the hero: large, expressive letterforms that make statements, paired with refined body text. White space should feel generous and confident. Interactions should feel art-directed—subtle reveals, elegant hovers.

Draw inspiration from gallery openings, premium print design, the confident restraint of editorial spreads in prestigious publications. Each scroll should reveal work that speaks for itself.
promptAgencyBrutalist:
Create a ONE-PAGE PORTFOLIO LANDING PAGE for: {{context}}. Use a NEOBRUTALIST design style.

The design should feel raw, confident, and unapologetically bold—like a manifesto printed on a warehouse wall. High contrast colors (black, white, with punchy accents like electric yellow or hot pink). Typography should be oversized and commanding. Borders should be thick and visible. Elements might overlap intentionally. The aesthetic rejects polish in favor of impact.

Draw inspiration from punk zines, protest posters, brutalist architecture, the energy of creative rebellion. The page should make a statement before visitors read a single word.
promptAgencyElegant:
Create a ONE-PAGE PORTFOLIO LANDING PAGE for: {{context}}. Use an ELEGANT MINIMAL design style.

The design should feel like entering a pristine gallery—hushed, refined, where every detail has been considered. Extreme reduction: only what matters remains. Typography should be delicate yet confident, perhaps a refined serif or elegant sans-serif. Colors should be muted: warm whites, soft grays, perhaps a single accent. Animations should be subtle and unhurried.

Draw inspiration from high-end galleries, luxury fashion presentations, the quiet confidence of spaces where quality speaks for itself.
promptProductLuxury:
Create a ONE-PAGE PRODUCT LANDING PAGE for: {{context}}. Use a LUXURY MINIMAL design style.

The design should evoke entering an exclusive boutique where every detail has been considered. Extreme reduction—only what matters remains. Generous white space signals premium quality. Typography should be refined and restrained. Colors should be muted and sophisticated. Animations should feel smooth and unhurried, like the confident pace of luxury experiences.

Draw inspiration from high-end retail spaces, the weight of quality packaging, products where craft is evident in every detail. Visitors should feel they've discovered something special.
promptProductGlass:
Create a ONE-PAGE PRODUCT LANDING PAGE for: {{context}}. Use a GLASSMORPHISM design style.

The design should feel like peering through frosted glass into a world of depth and dimension. Translucent panels with backdrop blur effects create layers. Subtle borders catch light. The background should have gentle gradients or abstract shapes that show through the glass layers. Typography should be clean and modern. Colors should be soft but vibrant—perhaps pastels or gentle gradients.

Draw inspiration from modern iOS interfaces, morning light through frosted windows, the layered depth of physical glass objects. The page should feel futuristic yet tactile.
promptProductBold:
Create a ONE-PAGE PRODUCT LANDING PAGE for: {{context}}. Use a BOLD & VIBRANT design style.

The design should feel energetic, confident, and impossible to ignore. Bold, saturated colors that pop. Dynamic shapes—circles, waves, abstract forms—that create movement. Typography should be chunky and impactful. Animations should feel bouncy and playful. The overall effect should be joyful and energizing.

Draw inspiration from pop art, modern packaging design, the boldness of brands that aren't afraid to stand out. Visitors should feel excited and energized.
promptLocalWarm:
Create a ONE-PAGE LANDING PAGE for: {{context}}. Use a WARM ORGANIC design style.

The design should feel like being welcomed into a thoughtfully designed space where you immediately want to stay. Warm, natural tones (terracotta, cream, sage, warm browns). Typography should feel approachable yet refined. Flowing, organic shapes soften the experience. Subtle animations should feel gentle and natural.

Draw inspiration from Scandinavian hygge, the warmth of spaces where regulars are greeted by name, places where food is made with care. Visitors should feel hungry—not just for food, but for the experience.
promptLocalModern:
Create a ONE-PAGE LANDING PAGE for: {{context}}. Use a MODERN BISTRO design style.

The design should feel sophisticated yet approachable—like a restaurant where the food is serious but the atmosphere is relaxed. Clean lines with warm accents. Typography should balance modern and classic (perhaps a refined serif for headings). Colors should be sophisticated: deep greens, warm neutrals, perhaps brass or copper accents. Photos should feel editorial and appetizing.

Draw inspiration from contemporary restaurant interiors, food photography in lifestyle magazines, the balance of casual and refined that defines modern dining.
promptLocalRustic:
Create a ONE-PAGE LANDING PAGE for: {{context}}. Use a RUSTIC ARTISAN design style.

The design should feel handcrafted and authentic—like discovering a gem that's been perfected over generations. Textured backgrounds (subtle paper, wood grain). Typography with character—perhaps hand-drawn elements or vintage-inspired fonts. Warm, earthy colors (amber, deep red, cream, forest green). Elements should feel tactile and real.

Draw inspiration from hand-painted signs, vintage menus, the patina of well-loved spaces, the authenticity of places where recipes are passed down through generations.
creationAnalyticsPlaceholder: e.g. User engagement, Revenue analytics, Server monitoring...
creationAdminQuestion: What does your admin panel manage?
creationAdminPlaceholder: e.g. User accounts, Content, Settings, Permissions...
creationCRMPlaceholder: e.g. Sales leads, Customer accounts, Deal pipeline...
creationEcommercePlaceholder: e.g. Fashion apparel, Electronics, Handmade crafts...
styleAnalyticsDarkDesc: Information-rich dark interface with glowing data visualizations
styleAnalyticsCleanDesc: Minimal white dashboard with crisp, scannable KPI cards
styleAnalyticsColorfulDesc: Vibrant charts and playful data storytelling
styleAdminSidebarDesc: Collapsible sidebar navigation with a spacious content area
styleAdminFriendlyDesc: Rounded corners, soft colors, approachable admin experience
styleCRMPipelineDesc: Kanban-style deal pipeline with drag-and-drop feel
styleCRMCardDesc: Contact cards with warm tones and quick-action buttons
styleCRMTableDesc: Powerful sortable tables with inline editing and filters
styleEcomCleanDesc: Polished storefront dashboard with clear order and product views
styleEcomDarkDesc: Sleek dark theme with neon accents for a premium feel
styleEcomPlayfulDesc: Bright gradients and fun illustrations for a lively store vibe
promptAnalyticsDark:
Create a ONE-PAGE ANALYTICS DASHBOARD for: {{context}}. Use a DATA-DENSE DARK design style.

The design should feel like a mission control room—information-rich yet perfectly organized. A dark background (near-black with cool blue undertones) lets glowing charts and KPI numbers pop. Use a sidebar or top-nav for navigation between data sections. Include area charts, bar charts, and sparklines rendered with vibrant accent colors (cyan, emerald, amber). Typography should be monospaced for numbers and clean sans-serif for labels.

Draw inspiration from Bloomberg Terminal aesthetics, Grafana dashboards, and NASA control rooms. Every pixel should serve the data.
promptAnalyticsClean:
Create a ONE-PAGE ANALYTICS DASHBOARD for: {{context}}. Use a CLEAN METRICS design style.

The design should feel crisp, scannable, and trustworthy—a dashboard you'd show in a board meeting. White or very light gray background with generous spacing between metric cards. Each KPI card should have a large number, a trend arrow, and a subtle sparkline. Use a restrained color palette: grays, one primary accent for positive trends, and a warm red for alerts. Charts should be simple line or bar charts with rounded corners.

Draw inspiration from Stripe's dashboard, Linear's clean UI, and the clarity of well-designed financial reports.
promptAnalyticsColorful:
Create a ONE-PAGE ANALYTICS DASHBOARD for: {{context}}. Use a COLORFUL INFOGRAPHIC design style.

The design should feel like a beautiful infographic come to life—data storytelling through color and shape. Use a light background with sections color-coded by data category. Donut charts, gradient area charts, and illustrated icons make statistics approachable. Typography should be friendly and rounded. Each section tells a mini-story with its data.

Draw inspiration from Dribbble dashboard concepts, annual report infographics, and the playful data visualizations of The Pudding. The dashboard should make data feel exciting, not intimidating.
promptAdminSidebar:
Create a ONE-PAGE ADMIN PANEL for: {{context}}. Use a SIDEBAR-FOCUSED CLEAN design style.

The design should feel organized and efficient—an admin's daily command center. A collapsible sidebar on the left holds navigation with icons and labels for each section. The main content area is spacious with a breadcrumb trail, a search bar, and well-structured data tables or card grids. Use a neutral color scheme (white, slate gray) with a single brand accent for active states and primary actions.

Draw inspiration from Notion's sidebar, Vercel's dashboard layout, and the structured clarity of well-designed CMS interfaces.
promptAdminCompact:
Create a ONE-PAGE ADMIN PANEL for: {{context}}. Use a COMPACT DENSE design style.

The design should maximize information density without feeling cluttered—every element earns its space. Smaller font sizes, tighter spacing, and multi-column layouts pack more data on screen. Use a top navigation bar with dropdown menus. Tables should have sortable columns, inline status badges, and compact action buttons. The color palette should be muted and professional: cool grays, subtle borders, minimal decoration.

Draw inspiration from AWS Console, Django Admin, and enterprise tools where power users need quick access to everything at once.
promptAdminFriendly:
Create a ONE-PAGE ADMIN PANEL for: {{context}}. Use a FRIENDLY MODERN design style.

The design should feel approachable and pleasant—an admin panel that new team members can navigate without a manual. Rounded corners on cards and buttons. Soft, warm colors (light lavender, soft blue, gentle green for success states). Generous padding and clear visual hierarchy. Use card-based layouts over dense tables where possible. Icons should be friendly and illustrative.

Draw inspiration from Shopify Admin, Airtable, and modern no-code tools. The panel should feel helpful, not intimidating.
promptCRMPipeline:
Create a ONE-PAGE CRM DASHBOARD for: {{context}}. Use a PIPELINE VISUAL design style.

The design should feel like a bird's-eye view of your entire sales process. The centerpiece is a horizontal Kanban-style pipeline with columns for each deal stage (Lead, Qualified, Proposal, Negotiation, Closed). Each deal card shows the contact name, value, and a small avatar. Above the pipeline, show summary KPIs: total pipeline value, win rate, deals closing this month. Use a clean white background with colored column headers.

Draw inspiration from Pipedrive, HubSpot deal boards, and Trello's drag-and-drop interface. The dashboard should make pipeline management feel visual and intuitive.
promptCRMCard:
Create a ONE-PAGE CRM DASHBOARD for: {{context}}. Use a CARD-BASED WARM design style.

The design should feel personal and relationship-focused—every contact is a person, not just a data row. Use warm tones (amber, terracotta, soft cream backgrounds). Contact cards feature rounded avatars, recent activity timelines, and quick-action buttons (call, email, note). A sidebar shows recent interactions and upcoming follow-ups. Typography should be warm and readable.

Draw inspiration from Apple Contacts, the warmth of personal address books, and relationship-first CRM tools like Folk and Clay. The dashboard should encourage meaningful engagement.
promptCRMTable:
Create a ONE-PAGE CRM DASHBOARD for: {{context}}. Use a DATA TABLE PRO design style.

The design should feel powerful and data-driven—built for teams managing hundreds of contacts. The main view is a full-width sortable, filterable data table with columns for name, company, status, last contact, deal value, and actions. Include a filter bar with dropdown filters and a search input. Row hover states reveal inline action buttons. Above the table, show aggregate stats in compact metric pills.

Draw inspiration from Salesforce list views, Airtable grid view, and spreadsheet-like interfaces that power users love. The dashboard should make large datasets feel manageable.
promptEcomClean:
Create a ONE-PAGE E-COMMERCE DASHBOARD for: {{context}}. Use a SHOPIFY-INSPIRED CLEAN design style.

The design should feel polished and commerce-ready—a store owner's daily headquarters. Clean white background with a left sidebar for navigation (Orders, Products, Customers, Analytics). The main area shows today's key metrics (revenue, orders, conversion rate) in clean cards, followed by a recent orders table and a top products list. Use Shopify's signature green for primary actions and success states.

Draw inspiration from Shopify Admin, WooCommerce dashboards, and the clarity of well-designed e-commerce backends. The dashboard should make running an online store feel effortless.
promptEcomDark:
Create a ONE-PAGE E-COMMERCE DASHBOARD for: {{context}}. Use a DARK PROFESSIONAL design style.

The design should feel premium and sophisticated—like a high-end retailer's back office. Deep charcoal background with subtle card elevations. Neon accent colors (electric blue, vivid purple) highlight key metrics and interactive elements. Revenue charts glow against the dark canvas. Product thumbnails pop with subtle shadows. Typography should be modern and sharp.

Draw inspiration from luxury brand admin panels, dark-themed trading platforms, and premium SaaS dashboards. The interface should feel exclusive and powerful.
promptEcomPlayful:
Create a ONE-PAGE E-COMMERCE DASHBOARD for: {{context}}. Use a COLORFUL PLAYFUL design style.

The design should feel joyful and energetic—running a store should be fun! Use bright gradients (pink-to-orange, blue-to-purple) as accents on cards and charts. Rounded corners everywhere. Include small illustrated icons or emojis next to metrics. Product cards should feel like mini storefronts with playful hover animations. Use a light, airy background with colorful section dividers.

Draw inspiration from Gumroad's playful aesthetic, Etsy's creative energy, and indie brand dashboards. The interface should make sellers smile.
